text: Magnolia katiorum is a species of flowering plant in the family Magnoliaceae. It is endemic to Colombia, where it is known from a single location in the Pacific/Chocó natural region. It is a canopy tree of tropical forest habitat. It is known commonly as almanegra de Uraba.Calderon, E., Cogollo, A., Velasquez-Rua, C., Serna-Gonzalez, M. & Garcia, N. 2014. Magnolia katiorum. The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species 2014. Downloaded on 08 October 2015. The local habitat is fragmented and degraded, and the tree is harvested for wood. ==References== katiorum Category:Endemic flora of Colombia Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Magnolia katiorum
